alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:03AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Olmsted, Mower, southern Dodge and western Fillmore Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 701 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kasson, or near Dodge Center, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Byron around 705 AM CDT. Stewartville around 720 AM CDT. Grand Meadow around 725 AM CDT. Spring Valley around 735 AM CDT. Wykoff around 740 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Forestville State Park, Fillmore, County Roads 6 And 15, Rock Dell, Brookside Campground, County Roads 5 And 6, Mayville, Rochester Airport, Graves Landing Field and Waltham. People attending the Olmsted County Fairgrounds should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 216. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
